holidays.name: National Cocoa Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the warmth and chocolaty goodness of cocoa! Perfect for sipping a rich cup of hot chocolate and embracing cozy vibes.
holidays.origin: Believed to have originated in the U.S. as a way to honor the beloved winter drink made from cocoa beans.
holidays.funFact: The Aztecs considered cocoa beans so valuable they used them as currency, and pure cacao was once a sacred beverage.

holidays.name: Saint Lucy's Day (Santa Lucia)
holidays.description: A festival of lights celebrated in Scandinavia and Italy honoring Saint Lucy, symbolizing hope and light during the darkest time of year.
holidays.origin: Commemorates Saint Lucy, a Christian martyr who brought food and aid to persecuted Christians by wearing a candlelit wreath.
holidays.funFact: In Sweden, young girls dress as 'Lucia' with a crown of candles, serving saffron buns called 'Lussekatter' to family and friends.

holidays.name: National Day of the Horse
holidays.description: A day to appreciate and celebrate horses, their importance in history, and bonds with humans.
holidays.origin: Created to raise awareness about horse welfare and promote the equestrian community.
holidays.funFact: Horses have the largest eyes of any land mammal, allowing them to see nearly 360 degrees around!

holidays.name: International Day of Neutrality
holidays.description: A United Nations observance encouraging countries to remain neutral in conflicts and promote peace.
holidays.origin: Established by the UN in 2017 to strengthen the culture of peace and respect for sovereignty.
holidays.funFact: Switzerland is famously neutral and has not participated in a foreign war since 1815.
